meanings.definition: To refuse or neglect to oblige or accommodate
meanings.sent1: She disobliges her friend by not helping with the project.
meanings.sent2: It disobliges me when people don't say thank you.
meanings.sent3: His constant disobedience to requests can be quite disobliging.
meanings.sent4: The stubbornness of the old tree disobliges the gardener's efforts to prune it.
meanings.sent5: The cat's refusal to come inside disobliges its owner who worries about its safety.

meanings.definition: To cause inconvenience or annoyance to
meanings.sent1: The loud music from the party next door disobliges the neighbors trying to sleep.
meanings.sent2: Please don't disobliges others by leaving your belongings in shared spaces.
meanings.sent3: The rain disobliges the picnic plans, forcing everyone indoors.
meanings.sent4: The broken elevator disobliges the residents who have to climb the stairs.
meanings.sent5: His constant interruptions disobliges the speaker and disrupt the flow of the presentation.

meanings.definition: To fail to do a favor for
meanings.sent1: I hope he doesn't disobliges us by forgetting to pick up the cake.
meanings.sent2: She disobliges her colleagues by not sharing important information.
meanings.sent3: The cat disobliges its owner by knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The storm disobliges the travelers by delaying their flight.
meanings.sent5: He disobliges his friends by always arriving late to gatherings.
